Children who are recognized as preternaturally intelligent often go on to fulfill their early promise, contrary to the stereotype of maladjusted _________ wasting their gifts.
Blank (i)
(A) prodigies
(B) crackpots
(C) misanthropes
(D) dynamos
(E) juveniles
